organic_results.title: Students' perceptions of membership in their high schools
organic_results.snippet: Many recent school-reform efforts have advocated for designing schools in ways that promote students' perceptions of membership. This study investigated students' perceptions of school membership, linking student and school characteristics to these perceptions. Specifically, it drew on psychological, sociological, and educational theory to create a measure of perceived school membership consisting of three interrelated dimensions:(1) students' feelings of belonging,(2) students' commitment to school, and (3) students' …

publication_info.summary: BA Smerdon - Sociology of Education, 2002 - JSTOR
